body.p: This page describes the procedure to create volume type, associate volume type to backend, create volume, attach volume, detach volume, and delete volume. You perform this operation to verify the configuration of backend (VSA, Ceph, and 3PAR).

section.title: Create Volume Type to Verify the Configuration of Backend
section.p: Volumes are the Block Storage devices that you attach to instances to enable persistent storage. You can attach a volume or detach a volume and attach it to another instance at any time. You can also create and delete volume type and volumes.
Perform the following steps to create a volume using Horizon dashboard:

ol.li: Log into the Horizon dashboard as Admin. The Horizon dashboard displays with the options in the left panel.
From the left panel, click the Admin tab and then click the Volumes tab to display the Volumes page.
Click Create Volume Type to display a dialog box.
Enter a unique name for the volume.

Click Create Volume Type to complete the action. Clicking Cancel returns to the Volumes screen without completing the action.
The newly created volume displays in the Volumes page.

section.title: Associate the Volume Type to a Backend
section.p:
To map a volume type to a backend, do the following:
Login to the Horizon dashboard. The Horizon dashboard displays with the options in the left panel.
From the left panel, click the Admin tab and then click the Volumes tab to display the Volumes page.
Click View Extra Specs displayed against the volume type which you want to associate to the backend.
The Create Volume Type Extra Specs dialog box displays. Now map the volume type to the associate backend.
In the Key box, enter volume_banked_name as volume backend name. This is the name of the key used to specify the storage backend when provisioning volumes of this volume type. The volume backend name must match the backend name mentioned in the cinder.conf file.
For example: You can enter the following backend name for the respective backend used. The backend name is mentioned in the cinder.conf file.
VSA: You can enter vsa-backend-hlm003 in the key field.
Ceph: You can enter ceph in the key field.
3PAR FC: You can enter 3par_fc in the key field.
3PAR iSCSI : You can enter 3par_iscsi in the key field.
In the Value box, enter the name of the backend to which you want to associate the volume type.
Click Create to create the extra volume type specs. Once the volume type is mapped to the backend, you can create volumes with this volume type.

section.title: Create Volume from User Account
section.p:
Perform the following steps to create a volume using Horizon dashboard.
Log into the Horizon dashboard. The Horizon dashboard displays with the options in the left panel.
From the left panel, click the Project tab and then click the Volumes tab to display the Volumes page.
Click Create Volume to display a dialog box.
Enter the required details in the corresponding fields.
Click Create Volume to complete the action. Clicking Cancel returns to the Volumes screen without completing the action.
The volume is successfully created and the status of the volume is available.

section.title: Delete Volume from User Account
section.p: Perform the following steps to delete a volume using Horizon dashboard:

ol.li: Log into the Horizon dashboard. The Horizon dashboard displays with the options in the left panel.
From the left panel, click the Project tab and then click the Volumes tab to display the Volumes page.
Check the box in the row of the volume to delete.
Click Delete Volume to display the dialog box.
Click Delete the Volume to confirm the deletion of the selected volume. To exit without deleting the volume and to close the screen, click Cancel before deleting.
